features.ExpiWell - Score:
Listed here: https://www.expiwell.com/subscription
Details not public.
features.Movisens - Score:
Credit-Based
Details: https://docs.movisens.com/movisensXS/faq/#credits
(also, the dashboard has a Billing page)
Also, you can request a quote for features like Analysis Dashboard for XS.

features.Movisens - Notes: Based on their News (https://www.movisens.com/en/news/) and Recent Changes (https://docs.movisens.com/movisensXS/recent_changes).

features.ExpiWell - Notes: https://support.expiwell.com/portal/en/kb/

features.Movisens - Notes: Based on their News (https://www.movisens.com/en/news/) and Recent Changes (https://docs.movisens.com/movisensXS/recent_changes).

features.Feature Name: Interface to create and manage a study

features.Movisens - Notes: 3 sample studies

features.Feature Name: Publicly share study templates with the community

features.Avicenna (Ethica) - Notes: Not possible through the user interface. Must contact support.

features.Movisens - Notes: Respects device's localization. You can also contribute to translating via Transifex.

features.Feature Name: Support for eligibility screening of participants before they are enrolled in the study
Record responses to eligibility screening both for eligible and ineligible participants

features.MetricWire - Notes: MW uses URL for public enrollment.

features.Movisens - Notes: Each participant has a unique QR code which includes an auth token. They can scan within the app.

features.Feature Name: Enrollment available to the general public
Limit enrollment to invited participants only
Allow participants to see studies they are invited to, but not enrolled yet, via the app.
Send email to invited participants & follow up reminders
features.ExpiWell - Notes: When participant is invited, an email is sent to them. But there is no mechanism to send a follow-up reminder.
features.MetricWire - Notes: When participant is invited, an email is sent to them. But there is no mechanism to send a follow-up reminder.

features.Feature Name: Interface to view list of study participants
Filtering participants based on any of their data (e.g. notifications, survey responses, etc.)
Automatically calculate start and end of participation for each enrollment.
features.ExpiWell - Notes: ExpiWell uses Start Date for studies that have Rolling Enrollement schedules, which can be defined by researcher or chosen by the participant, but then they do not calculate or use an End Date. An Experience is simply pushed back down in the participant's app rather than passign an End Date and be marked as Completed.
Please refer to 1.5.4 for details.
features.Movisens - Notes: After they're coupled/joined, you can only change the end time. But before that, you can modify both start and end times.

features.ExpiWell - Notes: You can hide participants in the "Participation Log"

features.Feature Name: Direct chat room between a participant and a researcher
Direct chat room between two researchers of the study.
Group chat rooms between one or more researchers and a participant
features.Movisens - Notes: "Enable Messaging" as part of "Study Running" node in the sampling section.

features.Feature Name: Group chat room between all researchers of the study
Log all actions taken by a participant
features.MetricWire - Notes: Events that do not have a trigger associated with them will not show up under Survey/Triggers/View Logs. You can find them under the Participant Activity tab for each participant when you click "View Activity" for a survey.

features.Feature Name: Log all actions taken by a researcher
For any changes, specify the date, time, and user
For any change include the old value and new value
Capturing the reason for a given action

features.m-Path - Notes: While m-Path manual talks about consent in detail, there is no `Consent` feature in the app, and the consent process is implemented by using surveys. Researchers can add one- or multiple-page surveys, where each question contains one page of the consent, and then they can use branching features of the survey to include or exclude participants in the study.
features.Movisens - Notes: The first page of their consent section is about the app itself and also asks if they want to send anonymous crash reports. Then the study consent will show. Text with few formattings supported. And they have "Participant has to sign informed consent with his signature." setting which asks the participants to sign with their finger signature.

features.m-Path - Notes: Please refer to Single-page Consent for details.

features.Feature Name:
Mid-Study Consent

This refers to the process where the study protocol changes in the middle, and the researcher has to send an additional consent form to participants to sign before they continue on the modified protocol.
features.Movisens - Notes: Although you won't be able to publish all changes at once (like a study version). If you change the protocol and save, and then the participant syncs before you get to updating the consent, the participant would see the old consent.

features.Feature Name:
Consent through legally acceptable representative

Can consent be provided via a guardian, parent, or caretaker?
Option to capture handdrawn signature during consent
Define multiple arms in a study
features.ExpiWell - Notes: This is done by defining multiple groups in the Screener.

features.Feature Name: Define conditions on which participants should be assigned to each arm
features.ExpiWell - Notes: You can specify based on answers to screening survey, which arm they should be assigned to.

features.Feature Name: Define variations in the study protocol for each arm, such that participants receive partially different protocol depending on their arm allocation.
Query any data (participants, sessions, responses) based on the participant's site affiliation.
Central interface to manage study notifications
Define notification templates to be used across the study

features.ExpiWell - Notes: The documentation emphasizes on unreliability of the offline notifications, and offers alternatives (online notifications or emails). By default offeline notifications are disabled.
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.

features.Feature Name: Conditional notifications (e.g. based on survey responses)
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node and conditional sampling nodes.

features.Feature Name: Support for sending one-off notifications to one or more participants
features.MetricWire - Notes: Options include Push Notification, SMS, and automated Phone Call.
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Message All" which sends a chat message.

features.Feature Name: Support for sending notifications to researchers
features.m-Path - Notes: m-Path has a mechanism to email researchers. This is presented as a "Question", which is added as a module. It works like "If variable X is equal to Y, send email". This is defined within the survey. We categorized this as "Conditional Notification", rather than sending notification to researcher. That's because sending notification to researcher entails considerably more than this feature only.

features.Feature Name: Allow researchers to configure what notifications they want to receive and through what medium.
Sending notifications before or after a certain event
features.ExpiWell - Notes: ExpiWell have very limited features for sending notification after an event is detected, but it's less than one third of the scope of this item, and that's why it's marked as Not Supported
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.

features.Feature Name: Piping study variables in the notification content

features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.

features.Feature Name: Sending notifications via chat apps such as WhatsApp or Telegram
Track delivery of notifications and report their success or failure
Show notifications scheduled in the future

features.MetricWire - Notes: Participants get an invitation email.

features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.
Via "Alarm" sampling node.

features.ExpiWell - Notes: ExpiWell supports Survey Submission and Exit Survey. It's unclear how they are different. We considered both as "When a survey session is completed".
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.
Couldn't find an easy flow to achieve this.

subcategories.ExpiWell - Notes: ExpiWell's Triggering Logic has some major limitations. For example, (a) one schedule type can be chosen for the entire study, (b)

features.MetricWire - Notes: Via Ongoing Trigger
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Button Pressed" sampling node. You can adjust label and order (the order of the buttons on the home screen). The higher the order/weight, the deeper it sinks. Also, you can set it as a one-time button. And you can define groups for buttons using Button Group (on request). Groups can be minimized.

Called "Incomplete" or "Timed out". Via "Timeout Interval" property (after how many seconds of inactivity a timeout warning will be shown) of Form sample node. You can set it for each form TL. Also, you can set length of the timeout alarm in seconds for each form TL. The alarm will trigger whether the form is open or not.

features.MetricWire - Notes: Only supports once presented, daily, and random.

features.Feature Name: Time-based Activity Triggering - Support for relative and absolute time
features.Movisens - Notes: For the relative part (registration date only), you can use "Sampling Day" combined with other sampling nodes.

features.Feature Name: Time-based Activity Triggering - Support for exact time vs. random within a time-window
features.Movisens - Notes: For the random part, only the time (HH:mm) is supported. This event fires randomly a specified number of prompts in the specified time period and triggers the successor nodes. It also supports a Minimum Time Between Prompts. And you can specify the period using mutable values. The random time trigger follows a stratified randomization instead of allowing random prompts at any possible time. It takes the set time frame and divides it equally to accommodate the number of required prompts. It’s within these smaller chunks that the random prompt appears, only governed by the minimum time between prompts.

features.Feature Name: Time-based Activity Triggering - Repeat logic (e.g. repeat daily, weekly, monthly, etc.)
features.ExpiWell - Notes: It only allows repeating a survey every X days until a certain date.
features.Movisens - Notes: They have these sampling nodes: Weekday, Date Range, Time Range, Initial (fires only once after the previous node is true), Repeated (via defined interval and as long as the previous condition stays true)

features.Feature Name: Trigger activity based on the time chosen by the participant (e.g. using a previous calendar question)
features.Movisens - Notes: Only on the time part (HH:mm) using "Time Range" sampling or "Participant Time Trigger" (on request, which allows you to repeat every day too) node.

features.Feature Name: Trigger activity based on another event from the current participant (e.g. survey completed)
features.Movisens - Notes: You can define Mutable Values after a form completion and use that value as a condition in triggering another form combined with "Immediatly" sampling node. Also, you can use "Delay" sampling node to delay triggering the next form or action.

features.Feature Name: Trigger activity based on another event from another participant
Create one-off sessions one at a time.

features.Movisens - Notes: On request. Called "Nearby Devices Condition"; a sampling node. It uses the IBeacon standard. Also, it lets you specify Broadcast Signal (toggle), Scanning Interval, and Time Between Scans.

On request. Via "Geofence Trigger" or "Multi Geofence Trigger". This event fires if a given geofence or any of the given geofences was entered/left or the participant is staying in it over some time. Other than the geofence itself, you can specify whether the geofence should trigger the initial location of the participant dependent on the geofence.
On request only. You should specify the Distance the device must travel to trigger a location change.

features.Avicenna (Ethica) - Notes: Avicenna only supports single line criteria, not calculated values.
features.Movisens - Notes: For sections/questions, it's called "Visibility Rule". For sampling, it's a Check Mutable Value (on request).

features.Feature Name: Support for creating new variables and exporting them to be used within the study flow
features.Movisens - Notes: You can create them via "Mutable Value Editor" (on request), "Save answer as mutable value" for form questions (on request), and "Change Mutable Value" sampling node dynamically. Regarding the latter option, I'm not sure whether this means question responses linked to mutable values will be affected or not. You can set, increment, or decrement. You can define variables based on responses to these question types: Select One, Likert Scale, Visual Analog, Decimal, Number, Number Picker, Display Random Word, Text, Time, Date & Time; not Date.

features.Feature Name: Visual script editor for one-liner codes
features.Movisens - Notes: For sections/questions, it's called "Visibility Rule". For sampling, it's a Check Mutable Value (on request).

features.ExpiWell - Notes: Logs show some information. But we could not find a list of sessions scheduled for our participant.
features.MetricWire - Notes: Based on the screenshots, it seems MW has an interface that allows researchers to see what sessions a given trigger may generate, but there is no interface to show all sessions assigned to a given participant.

features.Feature Name: Query sessions based on participant, activity, time, or any combination
Quick view on session's metadata (ID, Status, Time prompted, Time Completed, etc.)

features.ExpiWell - Notes: You can see a bar chart of completed sessions per day per survey in the Responses tab.

features.Feature Name: Allow participants to cancel a session.
features.Movisens - Notes: Referred to as "Dismiss".

features.ExpiWell - Notes: By creating a new activity and specifying the source of it as one of the existing activities

You cannot move an activity to a different survey, but you can go to the destination survey, and create a new activity, and specify the source as another activity in your original study. This way, you can create a copy of your activity in another study.
features.m-Path - Notes: m-Path does not define a study as seen in other platforms.

features.Feature Name: Export survey definition in a textual format

features.Movisens - Notes: You can print (CTRL+P). Not all details are included though.

features.Feature Name: Import survey definition from a file (textual or spreadsheet)
Maintain versions across changes to survey
Publicly share survey templates with research community

features.ExpiWell - Notes: Does not support HTML, but allows rich text formatting.
features.MetricWire - Notes: Offers limited options for formatting question content.

features.m-Path - Notes: Can only include one media, either one image, one audio, or one video. More than that requires multiple questions.
features.Movisens - Notes: Using "Play Audio" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. Also, you can specify whether scrubbing (changing time in audio) is allowed: And the audio can have a headline.

Using "Display Image" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. And the image can have a headline. On their Pricing page, they say "Items which generate an answer inside your results will count as one credit (e.g. Display Image)".
On request. Using "Display Video" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. It displays a Video from SD Card. Also, you can specify whether it should auto-start.

features.Feature Name: Visualize responses to a question within the app
View past responses to a question while answering that question
features.Avicenna (Ethica) - Notes: You can use Piping to get the response to the last question and display it as part of the survey content.
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Save answer as mutable value" and "Display Mutable Value" form item.

features.Feature Name: Set minimum & maximum display time for a question
features.Movisens - Notes: You can put the question inside a Multi-Item Screen and set the MIS's "Auto advance time" for the maximum display time. The items (questions) in that MIS must be marked as not required.

features.Feature Name: Piping values into question content from current participant
features.ExpiWell - Notes: This is only possible for questions from the current survey.
features.MetricWire - Notes: This is only possible for questions from the current survey.
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Mutable Values" and "Display Mutable Value" form item.

features.Feature Name: Piping values into question content from another participant

features.Movisens - Notes: Called "Label". You will see them as a column header in your downloaded results table. Labels must start with a letter and can only consist of letters, numbers, "-", and "_". Labels are unique within the whole study. This differs from "Save answer as mutable value".
Called "Stored Value".
In some item formats (e.g. Visual Analog Scale) a default value is present. In this case, the required field will be ignored.

features.Feature Name: Allow researchers to put private comments on specific questions

subcategories.ExpiWell - Notes:
- "Rating Star" question is excluded, as it's not available in any other platform, and VAS question is used instead.
- "Branching Forced Choice Question" is not included, because it can be implemented using branching and three questions. Also as the explanation video says, this is a custom feature created for a client rather than representing a wider need in EMA studies.
- "Counts" question is excluded because it's the same as "Number" question. The interface also uses the same elements (+/-) as the Avicenna's number question.

features.Movisens - Notes: Via a combination of Display Text, Play Audio, and other Output form items in one Multi-Item Screen.

features.Feature Name: Ability to show participant's responses in textual format as part of the survey flow.
Ability to show visualizations of participant's past responses as part of the survey flow.

features.MetricWire - Notes: Text question types in MW do not have an enforced format option. However, each format has different question types (email, phone number, and percentage).

features.ExpiWell - Notes: There is a "Format" option, but the selections are limited to Number and Date. We have marked those as "Supported" below.
features.MetricWire - Notes: MW offers separate questions for email and phone number, which is the subset of enforcing a format on a text-based question.

features.Feature Name: Text - Option to record audio instead of or in addition to typing

features.Movisens - Notes: Called "Select Many".

features.Feature Name: Multiple-Answer Question - Support different layouts (button, checkbox, dropdown)

features.ExpiWell - Notes: A given question can only have one "None of the above" option.

features.Feature Name: Multiple-Answer Question - Using images as answer option

features.Movisens - Notes: Called "Select One".

features.Feature Name: Single-Answer Question - Support different layouts (button, radio-button, dropdown)
features.ExpiWell - Notes: You can add a "Drop-down" question which is the same as Single Answer question with drop-down layout. As other layouts are not supported, score is set to "Partial Support".

features.Feature Name: Single-Answer Question - Using images as answer option
SAQ / MAQ - Support for "Other" option, where participant can type in their choice.
features.Avicenna (Ethica) - Notes: This should be achieved using branching.

features.Feature Name: Self Learning Option, where a participant enters her response and for future survey sessions, that response is offered as an option to the participant.
features.Avicenna (Ethica) - Notes: This can be done in Auto-Complete Text questions.
features.m-Path - Notes: This can be done using self-learning multiple-choice questions.

features.ExpiWell - Notes: Via "Number Format" Text question
features.Movisens - Notes: They have 2 question types for this: Number and Decimal.

features.ExpiWell - Notes: Via "Number Range Format" Text question
features.Movisens - Notes: On request and via "Number Picker" and not the Number or Decimal.

features.Feature Name: Number questions - customized interface for length
Number questions - customized interface for weight

features.Movisens - Notes: Called "Visual Analog".
On request. Called "Left and Right Values".

features.Feature Name: VAS - Text for left & right anchor
features.Movisens - Notes: Also, they have a Neutral anchor.

features.Feature Name: VAS - image for left & right anchor
VAS - show specific text based on selection
features.m-Path - Notes: You cannot define the ranges for each option.

features.Feature Name: VAS - show specific image based on selection
VAS - Control appearance of slider thumb
features.ExpiWell - Notes: You can specify whether the thumb should appear on left, center, or right. No option to not show slider thumb by default.

features.Movisens - Notes: As a separate form item called "Time".
As a separate form item called "Date".

features.MetricWire - Notes: It must be separate questions
features.Movisens - Notes: As a separate form item called "Date & Time".

features.Feature Name: Calendar - Support entering period (e.g. from 10:30 to 12:15)
Calendar - Specify minimum and maximum value

features.MetricWire - Notes: It seems this is achieved via `Media Question`, but the description is unclear.

features.Feature Name: Image question - Take photo vs. select from gallery
features.Movisens - Notes: You can't have both options in one question. They have 2 form items: "Choose Picture" (on request) and "Take Picture"

features.MetricWire - Notes: It seems this is achieved via `Media Question`, but the description is unclear.

features.Feature Name: Audio question - Record vs. select from device
features.Movisens - Notes: Only recording is supported.

features.MetricWire - Notes: It seems this is achieved via `Media Question`, but the description is unclear.

features.Feature Name: Video question - Record vs. select from device
features.Movisens - Notes: Only recording is supported.
Called "GeoPoint" and partially forces the participant to keep the current location selected by the GPS/map.
You can't enter the code manually.
Some basic operations are supported on mutable values via "Change Mutable Value" sampling node. Then you can display that value using "Display Mutable Value" form item.
Called "Page Indicator" and you can adjust it for each form and TL in sampling.
For each survey and each TL you can enable/disable it.

features.Feature Name: Auto-forward to the next question when Single-Answer question is responded
Exclude / Include a question in the survey
Group a set of questions such that all of them have similar answer sets (e.g. "For the following statements, please select whether you agree or disagree")
Support for sections in a survey.
features.MetricWire - Notes: MW does not have sections. Instead, it allows grouping questions arbitrarily, as opposed to putting continuous questions in a section. We consider that as an alternative way of implementing sections.
features.Movisens - Notes: Called "Multi-Item Screen".

features.MetricWire - Notes: It can `Randomly Trigger a Single Group on Phone`.
features.Movisens - Notes: You should enable/disable it for each form TL separately.
You should enable/disable for each form TL separately. Questions that don't belong to any section (root questions) will be randomized. You can see such form as a form with one section.

features.Feature Name: Randomize answers within a question (for multiple-answer questions)
Anchor certain answers so they are not moved when randomization is performed.
Randomly select a subset of sections
features.MetricWire - Notes: Closest option to this is to randomly select 1 group and present that.
features.Movisens - Notes: On request. You should enable/disable for each form TL separately. You can show only the given count of all items in a stratified randomized order (if randomized is activated).

features.Feature Name: Randomly select a subset of questions within a section
features.Movisens - Notes: On request. You should enable/disable for each form TL separately. You can show only the given count of all items in a stratified randomized order (if randomized is activated). Questions that don't belong to any section (root questions) will be randomly selected. You can see such form as a form with one section.

features.Feature Name: Randomly select a subset of answers of a question
Show one question per page or one section per page
features.Movisens - Notes: You can structure your form on the root level by putting questions beside the sections.

features.Feature Name: Define and customize divider between questions (when an entire section is displayed)
features.Movisens - Notes: You can use Display Text with "________________" (or any other text) as the content.

features.Feature Name: Disable/Enable review and edit answers upon completion
features.MetricWire - Notes: Supports reviewing responses but does not support editing them.

subcategories.MetricWire - Notes: Branching and Skip Patterns are very poorly documented in MetricWire.

features.MetricWire - Notes: This can be done using Enable/Disable Question.

features.Feature Name: Jump to any part of the survey
Branching based on variables within the current survey
features.Movisens - Notes: Visibility rules can only be defined depending on previous items of the types Select One, Select Many, and Likert Scale.

features.Feature Name: Branching based on variables from other surveys
Branching based on variables from other participants
Allow researchers to fill in surveys for participants (similar to REDCap, eCRF)
View surveys as forms for faster data entry
Support creating surveys that can be answered by public without enrolling in the study (cross-sectional surveys)
features.MetricWire - Notes: Answers without enrolling are not supported, but there is an option "Anonymize Results" which hides PII and user ID.

features.Feature Name: Allow respondents to close the survey and reopen it to continue responding
Response metadata - Reason for response missing (skipped vs. randomized & not selected vs. branching)
features.m-Path - Notes: Skipped is available. "Randomized & not selected", and "branching skip" are not.
features.Movisens - Notes: Via a column called "Missing" for the whole form and not per each response. The values can be: Ignored = Participant did not respond to the alarm, Dismissed = Participant dismissed the alarm, Incomplete = Participant did not complete the form, Canceled_by_new_alarm = A new alarm canceled the previous alarm

features.Feature Name: Response metadata - Order by question as displayed to the participant
features.ExpiWell - Notes: The responses are sorted as they are presented in the current survey definition. If you add questions A, B, and C, get responses for your survey, and then re-order to B, C, and A, all exports will show B, C, and A.

features.Feature Name: Response metadata - Open time, per-question response time, completion time
features.Movisens - Notes: For the whole form they have: Trigger, Trigger Date/Time, Trigger Counter (This counter is incremented each time a trigger is executed. If multiple forms are placed after one another, then this counter has the same number for all these consecutive forms.), Form Start Date/Time, Form Finish Date/Time, Form Upload Date/Time

features.Feature Name: Response metadata - Participant interaction with question content's media (e.g. how much and how many times a video clip was watched)
Allow researchers to comment on individual response
Researchers can edit responses entered by other researchers (e.g. case report forms)
Researchers can edit responses entered by participants

features.Movisens - Notes: As a form item.

features.ExpiWell - Notes: As a survey item.

features.Feature Name: Support for showing an external web page within the app
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Display Web-Page" form item. On request only. Also, you can specify whether it should add participant metadata to the request.

features.Feature Name: Counter button: a button which is shown prominently on the UI and pressing it counts a certain variable
Show all responses a participant has given to a set of questions within the app
Visualize all responses a participant has given to a question within the app
Bar chart plot of variables defined during computation scripting

Generate statistics on responses to a survey within a group of participants

Using this option, the researcher can divide participants into a few cohorts (e.g. by labeling them) and then calculate certain statistics on each cohort, for example, a five-number summary of all responses provided to a certain question, and show that to all participants within that cohort.
Visualize responses to a question from all participants part of a group
Display list of awards a participant has received
Display awards the participant can receive and his/her progress towards those awards
Customize the award condition based on survey progress
features.Movisens - Notes: On request. For each form TL, you can mark "Include Form to Gamification". If marked, the completions or incompletions will be used in gamification score calculation.

subcategories.ExpiWell - Notes: ExpiWell offers a way to share projects with other researchers, but this assumes the researchers are external collaborators rather than another team members. Their "Project Sharing" feature is not intended to define roles and responsibilities exist in a research team, and control who can do what within the team. That's why all of the following features are marked as "Not Supported"

features.Feature Name: Define roles & assign researchers to roles
Control permissions for working with different parts of study protocol (e.g. study settings, survey definitions, etc.)
features.MetricWire - Notes: While MW does not support roles, you can specify per researcher what actions they can take.

features.Feature Name: Control permissions for working with different parts of study data (e.g. participants, survey responses, sensor data, etc.)
features.MetricWire - Notes: While MW does not support roles, you can specify per researcher what actions they can take.

features.Feature Name: Different permission profiles for different study sites
Permission levels for Full, View-Only, and None

subcategories.Comments:
Please note that "API key rotation" is not properly checked and maybe unreliable. Also, for other metrics, we used the self-attestation from the documentation and did not check whether a feature exist.
Consider adding details of HIPAA/GDPR, such as backup process, physical access security, employee background check, regular peneteration and vulnerability test, disaster recover plan, BAA and DPA signature, using anti-virus and anti-malware software, regular software update.

features.MetricWire - Notes: 2FA is mandatory for all Metricwire Research Accounts.

features.Movisens - Notes: At least 8 characters length and maximum 64 characters length, at least 1 upper case letter, at least 1 lower case letter, at least 1 special character

features.Feature Name: Blocking access for a certain period in case of multiple failed login attempts

features.ExpiWell - Notes: https://www.expiwell.com/post/release-notes-newly-enhanced-features-to-help-improve-the-work-you-do
features.Movisens - Notes: Either they didn't have any update between 2022-02-04 and 2024-01-31 or their release notes are outdated. Note that they don't have any update after 2024-01-31 either.

features.Avicenna (Ethica) - Notes: In each email reply, a URL is provided that researcher can click on it to escalate her issue to receive faster reply.

categories.MetricWire - Notes: Sensor data in MW is very weakly documented. The content is limited to a single page under `Frequently Asked Questions` section. So the information here may be inaccurate.

features.Feature Name: Support for collecting data during custom intervals
features.MetricWire - Notes: Researchers can set start date for the trigger.

features.Feature Name: Support for adjusting sampling attributes such as rate or accuracy
features.Movisens - Notes: For some of their data sources only. For example, for "Nearby Devices" you can specify "Scanning interval" and "Time Between Scans".

features.Feature Name: Dashboard to manage sensor-based data sources
features.Movisens - Notes: They say "The mobile sensing features are only available on request!". I couldn't test it.

features.Feature Name: Reports to monitor and visualize incoming data

features.Movisens - Notes: On request. Called "Location" and it uses GPS, WLAN, and Cell to balance the battery usage with precision.
On request. Called "Steps".
On request. Called "Physical Activity". You can specify the minimal interval to log the physical activity, but activity may be logged more often, if requested by other apps.
On request. Called "Display On/Off".
On request. You can also limit the logs to specific apps. Just logs the app identifier.
On request. Called "Battery Level" and just logs the battery level.
Called "Nearby devices".

features.Feature Name: Allow participants to see their progress in the app
features.m-Path - Notes: The provided feature only shows the surveys scheduled for that day. This is less than 20% of the configurations defined in Avicenna. Hence this is marked as "Not Supported".

features.Feature Name: Allow participants to change the app font.
features.Movisens - Notes: Only the font size.

features.Feature Name: Allow participants to change the alarm sound.

features.Movisens - Notes: Participants can "Finish the study" when they pause the study. But it won't mark them as "dropped".

features.Feature Name: Allow participants to delete their account and all associated data via the app.
Allow participants to choose preferred notification channel
Allow participants to provide feedback directly via the app
features.Movisens - Notes: Via "Send Debug Information".

features.Feature Name: Allow participants to participate in multiple studies in parallel within the app.
features.m-Path - Notes: Because m-Path does not have a concept of `Study`, it is not clear what would happen if a `Client` adds multiple `Practitioner`.
features.Movisens - Notes: You should finish a study first before starting another one.

features.Feature Name: Allow researchers to pair their phone via the app to their account and test study flow
Allow researchers to enter into debug mode in the app to diagnos issues related to the participant or study design.

subcategories.MetricWire - Notes: MW Documentation has a section called Analysis and another section called Codebook. But the content there is very vague without any screenshots, so it's hard to know what feature is offered and how that fits within their software.

features.Feature Name: Choose columns to be shown in a table of the dashboard (customize table formats in the dashboard)

features.Movisens - Notes: No table is sortable even on UI.

features.Feature Name: Query data of a page in the dashboard
Query data of a page in the dashboard based on other data (e.g. query notification data based on participant attributes)
Query on aggregated data (e.g. more than 10 missed notifications)
Export query results (e.g. as CSV, XLSX, etc.)
Export survey responses as CSV, TSV, XLSX, or similar textual format
features.Movisens - Notes: They support Excel 2007 (XLSX), Comma-separated values (CSV), Semicolon-separated values (CSV), and Multimedia Results (ZIP).

features.Feature Name: Export survey responses' media files (recorded audio, captured images, or videos)
features.m-Path - Notes: m-Path stores media files in a separate third-party file storage server. To access the files, the researcher should go to this third-party website. So no feature to export these media files exist on the platform.
features.Movisens - Notes: All multimedia results are exported as ZIP.

features.Feature Name: Customize export format (e.g. long or short format, which questions to be included in export, etc.)

subcategories.MetricWire - Notes: Sensor data in MW is very weakly documented. The content is limited to a single page under `Frequently Asked Questions` section. So the information here may be inaccurate.

features.Feature Name: Export sensor data in textual format
features.Movisens - Notes: Unisens Log File (ZIP) for all logs and Unisens Log File in minutes (XLSX) for aggregated logged data.

features.Feature Name: Export sensor data in sensor-specific formats (e.g. Google Earth format for GPS data)
features.Movisens - Notes: KMZ for only the location data with an accuracy better than 100m.

features.Feature Name: Interface to plot & visualize sensor data
GPS Feature Extraction using AI/ML Models
Interface to purchase and activate license online
Interface to show quota used from each license
features.Movisens - Notes: They have a Billing page including used credits per study.
On request as part of their InteractionDesigner (https://www.movisens.com/en/products/interactiondesigner/). Also, it seems to only support a chat-based interface.
